#ptl02
CN - PTL02 Sight
Zoom : 6.0x - 11.0x

Usage method : Put the. blk file in the folder of the vehicle，Restart the game，Select a custom sight in Game Options - General Combat Settings
Example : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_ptl_02

使用说明 : 把.blk文件放到对应载具的文件夹内，重启游戏或重新加载自定义瞄具，在游戏选项-通用战斗设置中选择自定义瞄具。
例 : E:\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\War Thunder\UserSights\cn_ptl_02

I made a sight based on Daebom's dicker max character, it's one of the first sights I made, but I think it turned out alright, I also made only one version so im not sure how it will look like on tanks with less or more zoom than the ones I tested it on, but it should work on all tanks as long as you put it in War Thunder\UserSights\all_tanks


Please check out Daebom's videos and channel if you haven't, this scene in particular comes from here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iw9hhu9VQ5I

UPDATED 15/3-2024
~HISTORICAL SIGHT FOR ALL M109 VARIANTS~

The field manual I used to make the previous sights is incorrect (FM 6-88), so I remade them based on their technical manuals instead.

The standard M109 Howitzer uses the Telescope M118, M118C or M118CA1. The American, British and Israeli M109A1s use the M118CA1, calibrated for the faster M107 shell. The German and Italian M109Gs use a different German sight which I unfortunately haven't found any information about yet. The Israeli M109 never got the faster M107 shell and therefore uses the M118 or M118C (I went wi...

2S25M "Sprut-SDM1" custom sight
*Updated for 3BM60 on 29 January*

To change the color of sight use your "Crosshair lighting" keybind.

Installation: Unzip/extract the file and paste them inside your Warthunder folder in WarThunder > UserSights.

!WARNING! This sight is not compatible with other tanks. This is only compatible with the 2S25M "Sprut-SDM1". Check out my profile for sights on different USSR vehicles.

For any troubles, suggestions or sight requests you can find me in this discord server: RUzarfS4ua

Merkava Mk.1 & Mk.2 custom sight (Black Version)

To change the color of sight use your "Crosshair lighting" keybind.

Note: This is a special made sight on request with red and black highlight colors

Installation: Unzip/extract the file and paste them inside your Warthunder folder in WarThunder > UserSights.

!WARNING! This sight is compatible with other tanks, but it will not fit the screen properly due to the different sight characteristics like FOV. This is only 100% compatible with the Mk.1 and 2 series of Merkava, including Merkava Mk.1 and 2 from t...

FULL REMAKE DONE - 29/2-2024
~HISTORICAL 2S38 SIGHT~
4k, 1440p and 1080p. Difference: see document below

This is a completely historical sight for the 2S38 Derivaciya PVO. I also included a semi-historical version (picture 2) for tryhards. This sight is now updated with the correct field of view (9x11°) and almost every box is pixel-perfect (I counted pixels and converted them to mils, yes this took ages).

The sight has much more zoom in real life, so I made it as historical as possible in WarThunder.

Enjoy this sight realism-nerds! (I am one)

Sources/explana...

An original custom sight for the #centurion_avre and the #m728cev
It features a funnel, a stadimetric rangefinder and markings up to 3km

The #AVRE version have markngs for it's main gun and 7.62 coax
The #M728 version have markings for it's main gun, 7.62 coax and .50 turret

~HISTORICAL M71C TELESCOPE FOR M26, T25 AND T-26E1-1~
Requested by @speckiderkarpfen

  • Accurate M71C telescope for the M26 Pershing, premium M26 T99, T25 and the T26E1-1.
  • Should work for all tanks with M82 APCBC and 5x zoom.
  • Vertical lines are 200m, horizontal lines are 400m.
  • Horizontal lines are 5 mils with 5 mils between them.
  • The T-26E1-1 or T26E4 "Super Pershing" was meant to be fitted with an M71E4 telescope, but it was fitted with an M71C instead, so the ballistics won't match.

UPDATE 08/02-2024</...

Sights for T-10A and T-10M

Features:
- Distance corrections for 12.7/14.5mm MGs
- Number/Ticks for estimating the distance of a 3.3m-width target, such as Centurion and T-55
(From outside to the center, the number/ticks are for the target's visual width at 100, 200, 400, 600, 800 & 1600m)
- A design inspired by TPD-K1

Update on 2024.02.09
- Adjusted the green color for slightly improved readability under current game rendering

Installation:
Extract and drop the two folders into "UserSights" under the game folder

---

Quite some time ago I made a simple sight for the Type 93
Welp, it's basically the same for the Type 81
I just prefer this to the good ole default WT cross hair that feels odd for a SAM

The square represents the lock radar range and the circle represents the seeker lock range
There's a little cutout on the top of the circle with the firing order of missiles
And above the square there's the rangefinder result

Sight is green when unlit, red when lit

#spaa #type81 #type_81 #type81sam #sam
